snippet: The European Anti-Fraud Office is investigating trips by a former European Union official, during which he said he had planned to transfer large sums of money.
abstract: European Anti-Fraud Office is investigating trips to the Bahamas made by John Dalli, former European Union official who was forced to resign in fall 2012 over corruption case, during which he said he had planned to transfer large sums of money; case could lead office to reopen wider investigation into Dalli's activities while he was European commissioner for health and consumer protection.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and ANDREW HIGGINS

lead_paragraph: The European Anti-Fraud Office is investigating trips by a former European Union official, during which he said he had planned to transfer large sums of money.

headline.main: Ousted European Health Official Faces Questions About Plans to Transfer Money
headline.print_headline: Ousted European Health Official Faces Questions About Plans to Transfer Money
